Job Position: Reception Engineer / Workshop Administrator

	As a Reception Engineer in our company, you will have a unique opportunity to work with us as we navigate these exciting ventures, providing you with the experience of a lifetime.

	Coordinate the receipt and dispatch of trucks
	Ensure that all incoming and outgoing trucks are properly inspected for damages and defects

	Liaise with Workshop Supervision, diagnose defects by preliminary examination of vehicle or equipment condition
	Support installation, commissioning activities, field troubleshooting and upgrade campaigns.
	Liaise with other departments and manufacturers to ensure truck down time is kept to a minimum.
	Report warranty problems back to the manufacturing company
	Carry out inspections of vehicles arriving on site, either for repair (Vehicle condition survey) or brand-new vehicles for delivery


Education


	Minimum of HND in engineering, logistics, or a related field
	Relevant and recognised professional certification.

	Understanding of vehicle-related regulations and standards
	Knowledge of relevant regulations and standards related to truck logistics and safety
	Proficient in Microsoft Office and logistics software
	Familiarity with different types of vehicles
	Ability to diagnose vehicle-related issues
	Proficiency in using vehicle service equipment and tools.


Salary
N280,000 - N300,000 Monthly.

Method of Application

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Finance & Accounting Manager",
  "description": "Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things.

Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Finance &amp; Accounting Manager

Job Identification: 26128
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time
Job Category: Finance

About the Business Group


	Chief Financial Office is a diverse team at the frontline, delivering finance and business services, investor relations, and more across the world. Are you passionate about digital transformation, value openness and want to influence the direction of Nokia? Then, you may be the right fit.


About the Role


	Processes and monitors complex accounting transactions across multiple entities. Supports statutory, tax, internal, and external reporting (including SOX) for several legal entities.
	Contributes to the Country Accounting team, with responsibility for Financial Accounting Functions of multiple legal entities in Africa.
	In addition to these responsibilities, the FAM will also serve as the Country Finance Director (CFD) for the legal entities under their scope, assuming full accountability for financial governance, compliance, and strategic financial leadership at the entity level.


Your Responsibilities


	Manage accounting operations for multiple countries and legal entities, including statutory postings, financial statements, and related tasks.
	Lead statutory and tax audits, ensuring timely coordination and resolution across entities.
	Ensure compliance with indirect taxation, withholding tax, and corporate income tax regulations; interface with local tax authorities and review tax returns.
	Maintain and enhance internal controls in line with the FAM control catalogue.
	Uphold technical quality across accounting functions and provide governance for regional accounting standards and statutory requirements.
	Serve as a business partner on accounting matters arising from projects and daily operations.
	Identify, assess, and manage financial risks, providing timely insights and mitigation strategies.
	Monitor performance metrics and implement process improvements to enhance consistency, efficiency, and effectiveness.
	Support manual payments and clearing activities across entities.
	Assist with treasury operations, including bank engagement, statement provisioning, SOX control execution, and account funding.
	Respond to ad hoc requests with sound judgment and tailored solutions


Requirements
You have:


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 7 years of experience in local accounting and compliance, with exposure to multi-entity environments.
	Strong command of accounting principles, statutory financial reporting, and regulatory compliance.
	Proficient in SAP and Microsoft Excel, with the ability to navigate complex financial systems.
	Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve intricate accounting issues independently.
	Fluent in English, with excellent interpersonal, communication, and cross-cultural collaboration skills.
	Highly self-driven, results-oriented, and capable of performing under pressure with a proactive, hands-on approach.
	Strong analytical mindset, sound problem-solving skills, and solid business acumen across financial, technical, and internal control domains.


It would be nice if you also had:


	Experience leading functional teams or projects.
	Knowledge of international accounting standards (IFRS) and local tax regulations.
	Proficiency in various accounting software and ERP systems.
	Strong communication skills, particularly with executive leadership.


Benefits
Some of our benefits:


	Flexible and hybrid working schemes
	A minimum of 90 days of Maternity and Paternity Leave, with the option to return to work within a year following the birth or adoption of a child (based on eligibility)
	Life insurance to all employees to provide peace of mind and financial security
	Well-being programs to support your mental and physical health
	Opportunities to join and receive support from Nokia Employee Resource Groups (NERGs)
	Employee Growth Solutions to support your personalized career &amp; skills development
	Diverse pool of Coaches &amp; Mentors to whom you have easy access
	A learning environment which promotes personal growth and professional development - for your role and beyond.

title: Job Vacancies at Kuda Bank
content:
Kuda is a full service, app-based digital bank. Our mission is to be the go-to bank not just for those living on the African continent, but also for the African diaspora wherever they might live, anywhere in the world. Kuda is free of ridiculous banking charges and great at helping customers budget, spend smartly and save more. We raised the largest seed round ever seen in Africa, and completed a Series A funding round in February 2021, led by some of the world's smartest venture capital investors. With offices in London (our HQ), Lagos and Cape Town, and further offices opening across Africa during 2021, Kuda is fast becoming recognised as the leading 'Neobank' for Africans.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



To help us grow into the company that can bring meaningful change to the way people across Africa get access to great financial products and services in order to take control of their personal finances, we are actively looking for bright, talented, driven people who are excited by our mission. If this sounds like a great way to spend your valuable time, then please get in touch with us.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Direct Sales Agent

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Description
As a Direct Sales Agent, you will play a pivotal role in driving Kuda’s growth objectives through proactive sales efforts, effective relationship-building, and unwavering commitment to compliance and customer satisfaction.


	Prospect and generate leads through cold calling, networking, and referrals.
	Actively market Kuda’s array of financial products, including personal & business banking, loans, and POS terminals, to prospective customers within the designated territory.
	Achieve and exceed monthly sales targets by acquiring new customers and expanding customer base through persuasive techniques and a deep understanding of the bank’s offerings.
	Negotiate pricing and terms of sale to close deals and achieve sales targets according to the company's pricing.
	Conduct product demonstrations and presentations to potential clients.
	Ensure thorough compliance with all bank policies and regulatory requirements, including KYC (Know Your Customer) and AML (Anti-Money Laundering).
	Educate potential clients on the benefits of transitioning to electronic banking solutions and ensure their seamless onboarding to our platform.
	Maintain accurate records of all sales activities and customer interactions in CRM software.
	Participate in roadshows, community fairs, and other local events to promote the bank’s services and garner leads.
	Provide feedback to the marketing and product teams on customer experiences and product improvements.
	Understand the needs and requirements of prospective clients and proffer solutions to meet their specific business needs.
	Provide ongoing support to clients, including training and trouble shooting assistance.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Marketing, Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.
	Proven experience as a Direct Sales Agent or similar sales/customer service role; experience in the banking or financial services sector is highly preferred.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to negotiate and influence potential clients.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills; capable of managing multiple priorities efficiently.
	High motivation, enthusiasm, and dedication to achieving targets.
	Familiarity with digital banking services and mobile technology.


Target and Incentives


	Monthly sales target to be achieved.
	Incentives and bonuses based on meeting or exceeding sales targets.
	Additional rewards for surpassing performance goals and customer satisfaction metrics.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Product Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Role Overview


	We are looking for a Product Manager to join Kuda’s Fraud Prevention squad. In this role, you will focus on the strategy, development, and optimization of features aimed at preventing fraud across our platform.
	You’ll work on enhancing fraud detection mechanisms, reducing risks, and ensuring that Kuda continues to deliver secure and trustworthy financial services to our customers.
	You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Science, Engineering, Fraud Operation teams among others, to implement fraud prevention measures and ensure a seamless and secure user experience.
	This is a key role in helping us protect our customers and maintain Kuda’s reputation as a reliable, secure platform for digital banking.


Key Responsibilities


	Take ownership of the fraud prevention roadmap, working closely with the team to deliver features that enhance the platform’s security and reduce fraudulent activity.
	Collaborate with internal teams to define product requirements and ensure compliance with regulatory standards related to fraud detection and prevention.
	Monitor fraud-related metrics and OKRs, and use these insights to inform product decisions and improvements.
	Develop and enhance fraud prevention features, such as transaction monitoring, anomaly detection, and account verification.
	Collaborate with the Credit, Compliance, and Engineering teams to implement fraud detection models and solutions that balance security with user experience.
	Run and analyze A/B tests to evaluate the effectiveness of fraud prevention measures.
	Prioritize product features and improvements to mitigate fraud risks while maintaining a smooth user experience.
	Coordinate the development of features with cross-functional teams, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality execution.


Requirements


	5+ years of experience in product management, with a focus on fraud prevention or risk management.
	Strong understanding of fraud detection techniques, including transaction monitoring, anomaly detection, and fraud analytics.
	Familiarity with KYC (Know Your Customer) processes and regulatory requirements related to fraud prevention.
	Experience working with data to understand fraud patterns, analyze risks, and measure outcomes.
	Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including Design, Engineering, and Risk teams.
	A test-and-learn mindset: comfortable running experiments and using data to make informed decisions.
	Strong execution skills: focused on delivering impactful features with a bias for action.
	Excellent communication skills and ability to present findings and insights to internal stakeholders.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Head of Product - Credit

Job Location: Abuja
Job Type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Role Overview


	The Head of Product, Credit will lead Kuda’s Credit tribe, driving the strategy, execution, and continuous improvement of all lending-related products and initiatives.
	This role focuses on building reliable, scalable, and compliant credit solutions that deliver measurable business impact and exceptional customer experiences.
	You’ll own the tribe’s roadmap, delivery, and performance, ensuring decisions are data-driven and aligned with Kuda’s broader strategic and financial goals.
	You’ll also play a key role in building and developing a strong product team, fostering collaboration and accountability across stakeholders.


Responsibilities
Delivery & Execution:


	Lead tribe planning and QBRs, ensuring alignment, clarity, and dependency management.
	Champion thin-slice, iterative delivery focused on measurable outcomes.
	Provide consistent visibility to leadership through metrics, progress updates, and proactive risk management.


Data & Experimentation:


	Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making, establishing strong experimentation and measurement practices.
	Ensure squads have the insights, analytics, and tools needed for effective prioritisation.


3. Product Quality, Risk & Compliance:


	Ensure all products meet regulatory, compliance, and security requirements.
	Embed standards for reliability, performance, accessibility, and localisation into delivery practices.


People Leadership & Organisation Building:


	Hire, coach, and develop Product Managers across multiple levels.
	Foster a culture of clarity, focus, and ownership of outcomes.
	Define and uphold high standards for product discovery, delivery, and communication craft.


Day-to-Day Collaboration:


	With BLO: Align product strategy with business objectives and financial targets.
	With DM/TLs: Manage capacity, technical debt, and sustainable delivery practices.
	With Other Tribe Leads: Coordinate dependencies and shared initiatives.
	With Compliance, Legal, Marketing, and CX: Ensure alignment across customer, regulatory, and commercial goals.


Requirements


	5+ years of Product Management experience, including 2+ years leading teams or product portfolios.
	Proven track record of delivering measurable business outcomes.
	Strong fluency in experimentation, analytics, and data-driven prioritisation.
	Excellent stakeholder management and leadership skills.
	Experience mentoring and scaling Product Managers with a player-coach mindset.


Nice to Have:


	Background in financial services, payments, lending, or infrastructure.
	Familiarity with compliance frameworks and regulatory environments.
	Experience working with growth or data platforms.


Click here to apply online

 

 

4.) Head of Product - Credit
